channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mitigating Economic Risk in Multi-Factor Strategies
item.description: Here's a weighting scheme to mitigate economic risks while preserving the benefits of diversified multi-factor strategies.

item.title: United Auto Workers boss threatens Stellantis strike, says car giant reneged on its promise to restart an assembly plant outside of Chicago
item.description: “The UAW will take whatever action necessary at Stellantis or any other corporation to stand up and hold corporate America accountable,” Shawn Fain said at the DNC Tuesday.

item.title: Biden’s Charlottesville moment? POTUS torched for telling DNC anti-Israel mob outside ‘has a point’
item.description: President Biden raised eyebrows Monday night when he appeared to make a similar characterization about anti-Israel protesters to one he has pinned on Donald Trump regarding neo-Nazis in Charlottesville, Virginia.

item.title: Former Trump press secretary Stephanie Grisham to speak at DNC
item.description: Stephanie Grisham, who was former President Donald Trump's press secretary, plans to speak at the Democratic National Convention on Tuesday, adding her name to the roster of Republicans going on stage in Chicago to back Vice President Kamala Harris.

item.title: Kamala Harris Is No Investor
item.description: Like any huckster working in a boiler room, Harris is hoping to find people credulous enough to believes what’s too good to be true.

item.title: Rumble CEO: DNC Blocks Rumble From Streaming Coronation Of Kamala Harris In Chicago
item.description: The DNC barred the online video platform Rumble from streaming the party's nominating convention in Chicago.

item.title: Book Review: Risks and Returns
item.description: This highly readable book contains numerous entertaining anecdotes about, and descriptions of, the lifestyles of the rich and famous. Readers’ interest will never flag as they glean the chunks of wisdom that they can productively apply to investment analysis.

item.title: Finance firms decamping for south Florida have created an elite school vacuum. Vanderbilt now seeks to fill it
item.description: A shortage of elite school options has been a major pain point for younger wealthy families who’ve moved to South Florida to work at firms such as Citadel, Blackstone, and Goldman Sachs.

item.title: Biden speech delayed until after primetime
item.description: President Biden's keynote speech at the Democratic National Convention didn't start until after primetime and wrapped well after midnight on the East Coast.

item.title: The Obamas and Emhoff are to headline the Democratic National Convention on Tuesday
item.description: Former President Barack Obama, Michelle Obama and second gentleman Doug Emhoff will speak Tuesday on the second day of the Democratic National Convention, turning the party's attention toward Vice President Kamala Harris and her faceoff against Republican Donald Trump.

item.title: The Biden Family Scandal
item.description: The impeachment report prepared by House Republicans is an essential part of any record of the Biden-Harris administration.

item.title: Biden DOJ Asks SCOTUS To Keep Arizona From Requiring Proof Of Citizenship For 2024 Election
item.description: The U.S. Solicitor General requested that SCOTUS instead keep a circuit decision that prohibits state proof of citizenship requirements.

item.title: Opportunities in the Evolving Cannabis Consumption Market
item.description: For investors in the space, the changing cannabis consumption landscape opens challenges and opportunities in product creation, marketing, and targeting new consumer groups.

item.title: BurgerFi says it may file for bankruptcy
item.description: That would also be bad news for Anthony’s Coal Fired Pizza.

item.title: Benjamin Harrison won the White House by receiving the electoral majority, but losing the popular vote
item.description: Benjamin Harrison served as the 23rd President of the United States. He defeated incumbent Grover Cleveland in 1888, but lost to the Democrat in 1892.

item.title: Trump says he might hire Musk to Cabinet, advisory role
item.description: Former President Donald Trump says he would be open to naming the world's richest man, Elon Musk, to a Cabinet or advisory role if he defeats Vice President Kamala Harris in November.

item.title: Quantifying Medicare for All, Harris-style
item.description: The cost of the vice president’s vision of government-provided health care, outlined during the 2019 primary, would be stupendous.

item.title: Democrats Demand ID To Get Into Their Convention But Not To Vote For President
item.description: Individuals seeking to get into the DNC must show proof of identity 'for security screening' to pass through a security perimeter.

item.title: From Sandpiles to Angel Investments
item.description: The presence of power law returns in angel investing, with the potential for significant contributions from a handful of investments, has implications for portfolio construction, investment strategies, and diversification.

item.title: Transgender New Hampshire girl allowed to play soccer, judge rules, challenging governor’s ‘fairness in women’s sports’ law
item.description: The families of Parker Tirrell, 15, and Iris Turmelle, 14, filed a lawsuit seeking to overturn the “Fairness in Women’s Sports Act” that Republican Gov. Chris Sununu signed into law.

item.title: Democratic delegates approve platform with mistake mentioning Biden's second term
item.description: Delegates at the Democratic National Convention voted on Monday to approve a written party platform that repeatedly affirms President Biden as the party's presidential nominee.

item.title: Democrats' policy platform pitches what it calls 'tough but smart' U.S.-China policy that avoids war
item.description: A Kamala Harris administration would continue America's current policy of managing strategic competition with China in order to avoid war, according to a key plank of the Democrats' 2024 policy platform made public this week.

item.title: The Media Bristle at Inconvenient Facts on Immigration
item.description: They can’t handle the truth.

item.title: After Democrats Praise Walz As ‘America’s Dad,’ DNC Van Literally Neuters Men
item.description: It's an the odd juxtaposition: celebrating Walz as a father figure at the exact same time Democrats are pushing to make sure fewer men ever become fathers.

item.title: Book Review: Pause to Think
item.description: This book is direct, delightful, and articulate in suggesting that we take a slow rather than fast approach to getting things thoughtfully done. It touches the minds and hearts of investment professionals.

item.title: Elon Musk says he’ll take a job in the Trump cabinet if offered
item.description: Trump has publicly floated the idea.

item.title: Former teacher reveals which students suffered 'the most' under Walz's pandemic-era guidelines
item.description: A former Minnesota teacher told Fox News Digital that rules enforced by Gov. Tim Walz during the coronavirus pandemic poorly impacted immigrant students.

item.title: Trump says a Hannity town hall will replace the Sept. 4 presidential debate
item.description: Former President Donald Trump plans to appear on Fox News for a town hall event Sept. 4 after Vice President Kamala Harris declined to participate in a debate on the network.

item.title: Germany’s Brilliant Police Strategy: Give Us Your Knife, Get Free Netflix
item.description: Knife violence and mass immigration are merging into a crisis European officials are reluctant to seriously address.

item.title: How Far Can You Get In Georgia’s Elections With No ID But A Utility Bill?
item.description: Utility bills, among other listed forms of acceptable documents, are considerably lower-tech than DMV or Social Security records.
